sub_title: Maritime (sworn) translator English and Dutch. Dutch and English language training for Pilotage Exemption Certificates (PEC exams Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Vlissingen-Steenbank).
summary:
I translate nautical, nautical-technical and nautical-legal texts from English to Dutch and Dutch to English for the maritime sector. My specialist translations ensure that companies can communicate more professionally and effectively with their international clients and thereby achieve faster and better results.

I also provide successful maritime language training in Passive Dutch and Active English for foreign captains and officers in preparation for their 'module 2' language exams for a Pilot Exemption Certificate (PEC). The language courses are focused on the understanding of the Dutch maritime language in the ports of Amsterdam, Rotterdam and Vlissingen/Steenbank.
treasury_media: [{'url': None, 'title': 'Sinking about and Working with Maritime Language and Terminology', 'description': 'Maritime English (ME), the international working language in the maritime industry, is a Language for Special Purpose (LSP) of which a spoken variant, SMCP, acts as a controlled safety language. Text-based studies of Maritime English, although scarce, point to a concise syntax and grammar, a formal and impersonal style and a preference for nouns and nominal groups.', 'image': None}]
